info.title: Stripe API v2
info.description:
The v2 endpoints of the Stripe REST API. Please see https://stripe.com/docs/api for more
    details.

post.description: Cancel the Billing Cadence.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the billing Cadence to cancel.

get.description: Returns a list of Accounts.

parameters.name: applied_configurations
parameters.description: Filter only accounts that have all of the configurations specified. If omitted, returns all accounts regardless of which configurations they have.

parameters.name: closed
parameters.description: Filter by whether the account is closed. If omitted, returns only Accounts that are not closed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The upper limit on the number of accounts returned by the List Account request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token to navigate to next or previous batch of accounts given by the list request.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

data.description: A list of retrieved Account objects.

post.description: An Account is a representation of a company, individual or other entity that a user interacts with. Accounts contain identifying information about the entity, and configurations that store the features an account has access to. An account can be configured as any or all of the following configurations: Customer, Merchant and/or Recipient.

account_token.description: The account token generated by the account token api.

exempt.description: Describes the customer's tax exemption status, which is `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: “Reverse charge”.

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

location_source.description: The data source used to identify the customer's tax location - defaults to `identity_address`. Will only be used for automatic tax calculation on the customer's Invoices and Subscriptions. This behavior is now deprecated for new users.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Automatic indirect tax settings to be used when automatic tax calculation is enabled on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, checkout sessions, or payment links. Surfaces if automatic tax calculation is possible given the current customer location information.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

next_sequence.description: Sequence number to use on the customer account's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: Prefix used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3-12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: Indicates whether displayed line item prices and amounts on invoice PDFs include inclusive tax amounts. Must be either `include_inclusive_tax` or `exclude_tax`.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

invoice.description: Default invoice settings for the customer account.

billing.description: Billing settings - default settings used for this customer in Billing flows such as Invoices and Subscriptions.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Customer Configuration.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

phone.description: Customer phone (including extension).

shipping.description: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

test_clock.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer. Can only be set on testmode Accounts, and when the Customer Configuration is first set on an Account.

customer.description: The Customer Configuration allows the Account to be used in inbound payment flows.

display_name.description: Display name for Bacs Direct Debit payments.

bacs_debit_payments.description: Settings used for Bacs debit payments.

icon.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): An icon for the merchant. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

logo.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): A logo for the merchant that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the merchant's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

primary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for the merchant.

secondary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for the merchant.

branding.description: Settings used to apply the merchant's branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

capabilities.description: Capabilities to request on the Merchant Configuration.

avs_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

cvc_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

decline_on.description: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

email.description: Support email address for Konbini payments.

end_time.description: Support hours end time (JST time of day) for in `HH:MM` format.

start_time.description: Support hours start time (JST time of day) for in `HH:MM` format.

phone.description: Support phone number for Konbini payments.

konbini_payments.description: Settings specific to Konbini payments on the account.

mcc.description: The Merchant Category Code (MCC) for the Merchant Configuration. MCCs classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

kana.description: The Kana variation of statement_descriptor used for charges in Japan. Japanese statement descriptors have [special requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#set-japanese-statement-descriptors).

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

kanji.description: The Kanji variation of statement_descriptor used for charges in Japan. Japanese statement descriptors have [special requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#set-japanese-statement-descriptors).

script_statement_descriptor.description: Settings for the default text that appears on statements for language variations.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

address.description: A publicly available mailing address for sending support issues to.

email.description: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

phone.description: A publicly available phone number to call with support issues.

url.description: A publicly available website for handling support issues.

support.description: Publicly available contact information for sending support issues to.

merchant.description: Enables the Account to act as a connected account and collect payments facilitated by a Connect platform. You must onboard your platform to Connect before you can add this configuration to your connected accounts. Utilize this configuration when the Account will be the Merchant of Record, like with Direct charges or Destination Charges with on_behalf_of set.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

local.description: Enables this Account to receive OutboundPayments to linked bank accounts over local networks.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

wire.description: Enables this Account to receive OutboundPayments to linked bank accounts over wire.

bank_accounts.description: Capabilities that enable OutboundPayments to a bank account linked to this Account.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

cards.description: Capabilities that enable OutboundPayments to a card linked to this Account.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

stripe_transfers.description: Enables this Account to receive /v1/transfers into their Stripe Balance (/v1/balance).

stripe_balance.description: Capabilities that enable the recipient to manage their Stripe Balance (/v1/balance).

capabilities.description: Capabilities to be requested on the Recipient Configuration.

recipient.description: The Recipient Configuration allows the Account to receive funds. Utilize this configuration if the Account will not be the Merchant of Record, like with Separate Charges & Transfers, or Destination Charges without on_behalf_of set.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

bank_accounts.description: Can provision a bank-account-like financial address (VBAN) to credit/debit a FinancialAccount.

financial_addresses.description: Can provision a financial address to credit/debit a FinancialAccount.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

eur.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe in EUR.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

gbp.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe in GBP.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

usd.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe in USD.

holds_currencies.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

bank_accounts.description: Can pull funds from an external bank account owned by yourself to a FinancialAccount.

inbound_transfers.description: Can pull funds from an external source, owned by yourself, to a FinancialAccount.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

bank_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a bank account owned by someone else.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

cards.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a debit card owned by someone else.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

financial_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to another FinancialAccount owned by someone else.

outbound_payments.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a destination owned by someone else.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

bank_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a bank account owned by yourself.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

financial_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to another FinancialAccount owned by yourself.

outbound_transfers.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a destination owned by yourself.

capabilities.description: Capabilities to request on the Storer Configuration.

storer.description: The Storer Configuration allows the Account to store and move funds using stored-value FinancialAccounts.

configuration.description: An Account Configuration which allows the Account to take on a key persona across Stripe products.

contact_email.description: The default contact email address for the Account. Required when configuring the account as a merchant or recipient.

dashboard.description: A value indicating the Stripe dashboard this Account has access to. This will depend on which configurations are enabled for this account.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

locales.description: The Account's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

doing_business_as.description: The name which is used by the business.

product_description.description: Internal-only description of the product sold or service provided by the business. It's used by Stripe for risk and underwriting purposes.

fees_collector.description: A value indicating the party responsible for collecting fees from this account.

losses_collector.description: A value indicating who is responsible for losses when this Account can’t pay back negative balances from payments.

responsibilities.description: Default responsibilities held by either Stripe or the platform.

defaults.description: Default values to be used on Account Configurations.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the Account. This name will be surfaced in the Stripe Dashboard and on any invoices sent to the Account.

date.description: The time marking when the director attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the director attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the director attestation was made.

directorship_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the directors information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

date.description: The time marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

ownership_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

executives.description: Whether the company’s executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s executives with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

owners.description: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s owners with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

ownership_exemption_reason.description: Reason for why the company is exempt from providing ownership information.

persons_provided.description: Attestation that all Persons with a specific Relationship value have been provided.

date.description: The time marking when the representative attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the representative attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the representative attestation was made.

representative_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the representative is authorized to act as the representative of their legal entity.

date.description: The time when the Account's representative accepted the terms of service. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

account.description: Details on the Account's acceptance of the [Stripe Services Agreement](https://docs.stripe.com/connect/updating-accounts#tos-acceptance).

date.description: The time when the Account's representative accepted the terms of service. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

storer.description: Details on the Account's acceptance of Treasury-specific terms of service.

terms_of_service.description: Attestations of accepted terms of service agreements.

attestations.description: Attestations from the identity's key people, e.g. owners, executives, directors, representatives.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

address.description: The business registration address of the business entity.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing the amount in the smallest currency unit.

fiscal_year_end.description: The close-out date of the preceding fiscal year in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2023-12-31 for the 31st of December, 2023.

annual_revenue.description: The business gross annual revenue for its preceding fiscal year.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

bank_account_ownership_verification.description: One or more documents that support the bank account ownership verification requirement. Must be a document associated with the account’s primary active bank account that displays the last 4 digits of the account number, either a statement or a check.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

company_license.description: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company’s license to operate.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

company_memorandum_of_association.description: One or more documents showing the company’s Memorandum of Association.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

company_ministerial_decree.description: Certain countries only: One or more documents showing the ministerial decree legalizing the company’s establishment.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

company_registration_verification.description: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company’s registration with the appropriate local authorities.

parameters.description: Additional fields to include in the response. Currently supports `webhook_endpoint.url`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The requested page.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Create a new event destination.

description.description: An optional description of what the event destination is used for.

enabled_events.description: The list of events to enable for this endpoint.

events_from.description: Where events should be routed from.

include.description: Additional fields to include in the response.

metadata.description: Metadata.

snapshot_api_version.description: If using the snapshot event payload, the API version events are rendered as.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optionally set the maximum number of results per page. Defaults to 20.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Opaque page token.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

data.description: The list of retrieved Bill Setting Versions.

post.description: Simulate crediting a FinancialAddress in a Sandbox environment. This can be used to add virtual funds and increase your balance for testing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the FinancialAddress to credit.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: Object containing the amount value and currency to credit.

network.description: Open Enum. The network to use in simulating the funds flow. This will be the reflected in the resulting ReceivedCredit.

statement_descriptor.description: String explaining funds flow. Use this field to populate the statement descriptor of the ReceivedCredit created as an eventual result of this simulation.

get.description: Lists FinancialAccounts in this compartment.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page limit.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the FinancialAccount to filter by. By default, closed FinancialAccounts are not returned.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Creates a new FinancialAccount.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the FinancialAccount, up to 50 characters long. This name will be used in the Stripe Dashboard and embedded components.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the FinancialAccount.

holds_currencies.description: The currencies that this FinancialAccount can hold.

storage.description: Parameters specific to creating `storage` type FinancialAccounts.

type.description: The type of FinancialAccount to create.

post.description: Creates an Account Token.

contact_email.description: The default contact email address for the Account. Required when configuring the account as a merchant or recipient.

attested.description: A boolean indicating if the directors information has been attested.

directorship_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the directors information provided to Stripe is both current and correct; IP, date, and User Agent are expanded by Stripe.

attested.description: A boolean indicating if the beneficial owner information has been attested.

ownership_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct; IP, date, and User Agent are expanded by Stripe.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

executives.description: Whether the company’s executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s executives with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

owners.description: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s owners with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

ownership_exemption_reason.description: Reason for why the company is exempt from providing ownership information.

persons_provided.description: Attestation that all Persons with a specific Relationship value have been provided.

attested.description: A boolean indicating if the representative is authorized to act as the representative of their legal entity.

representative_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the representative is authorized to act as the representative of their legal entity; IP, date, and User Agent are expanded by Stripe.

account.description: The ID of the Account to create link for.

type.description: Open Enum. The type of Account Link the user is requesting.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). If you don’t specify collection_options, the default value is currently_due.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

collection_options.description: Specifies the requirements that Stripe collects from v2/core/accounts in the Onboarding flow.

configurations.description: Open Enum. A v2/core/account can be configured to enable certain functionality. The configuration param targets the v2/core/account_link to collect information for the specified v2/core/account configuration/s.

refresh_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to if the AccountLink is expired, has been used, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new AccountLink with the same parameters used to create the original AccountLink, then redirect the user to the new AccountLink’s URL so they can continue the flow. If a new AccountLink cannot be generated or the redirect fails you should display a useful error to the user. Please make sure to implement authentication before redirecting the user in case this URL is leaked to a third party.

return_url.description: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon completing the linked flow.

account_onboarding.description: Hash containing configuration options for an Account Link object that onboards a new account.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). The default value is `currently_due`.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

collection_options.description: Specifies the requirements that Stripe collects from v2/core/accounts in the Onboarding flow.

The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new Account Link with the same parameters used to create the original Account Link, then redirect the user to the new Account Link URL so they can continue the flow. Make sure to authenticate the user before redirecting to the new Account Link, in case the URL leaks to a third party. If a new Account Link can't be generated, or if the redirect fails, you should display a useful error to the user.

return_url.description: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon completing the linked flow.

currency.description:
Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

to.description: To which payout method to send the OutboundTransfer.

post.description: Create a Billing Cadence object.

interval_count.description:
The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between
cadence billings. For example, type=month and interval_count=3 bills every
3 months. If this is not provided, it will default to 1.

type.description: The frequency at which a cadence bills.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description:
The time at which the billing cycle ends.
This field is optional, and if not provided, it will default to
the time at which the cadence was created in UTC timezone.

day.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=day.

day_of_month.description:
The day to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from
1-31. If this number is greater than the number of days in the month being
billed, this will anchor to the last day of the month. If not provided,
this will default to the day the cadence was created.

month_of_year.description:
The month to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from
1-12. If not provided, this will default to the month the cadence was created.
This setting can only be used for monthly billing cycles with `interval_count` of 2, 3, 4 or 6.
All occurrences will be calculated from month provided.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description:
The time at which the billing cycle ends.
This field is optional, and if not provided, it will default to
the time at which the cadence was created in UTC timezone.

month.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=month.

day_of_week.description:
The day of the week to bill the type=week billing cycle on.
Numbered from 1-7 for Monday to Sunday respectively, based on the ISO-8601
week day numbering. If not provided, this will default to the day the
cadence was created.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description:
The time at which the billing cycle ends.
This field is optional, and if not provided, it will default to
the time at which the cadence was created in UTC timezone.

week.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=week.

day_of_month.description:
The day to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from
1-31. If this number is greater than the number of days in the month being
billed, this will anchor to the last day of the month. If not provided,
this will default to the day the cadence was created.

month_of_year.description:
The month to bill on from 1-12. If not provided, this will default to the
month the cadence was created.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description:
The time at which the billing cycle ends.
This field is optional, and if not provided, it will default to
the time at which the cadence was created in UTC timezone.

year.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=year.

billing_cycle.description: The billing cycle is the object that defines future billing cycle dates.

lookup_key.description: A lookup key used to retrieve cadences dynamically from a static string. Maximum length of 200 characters.

metadata.description: Set of [key-value pairs](/docs/api/metadata) that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

billing_profile.description: The ID of the Billing Profile object which determines how a bill will be paid.

payer.description: The payer determines the entity financially responsible for the bill.

id.description: The ID of the referenced settings object.

version.description:
An optional field to specify the version of the Settings to use.
If not provided, this will always default to the live version any time the settings are used.

bill.description:
Settings that configure bill generation, which includes calculating totals, tax, and presenting invoices.
If no setting is provided here, the settings from the customer referenced on the payer will be used.
If no customer settings are present, the merchant default settings will be used.

id.description: The ID of the referenced settings object.

version.description:
An optional field to specify the version of the Settings to use.
If not provided, this will always default to the live version any time the settings are used.

collection.description:
Settings that configure and manage the behavior of collecting payments.
If no setting is provided here, the settings from the customer referenced from the payer will be used if they exist.
If no customer settings are present, the merchant default settings will be used.

settings.description: The settings associated with the cadence.

parameters.description: The page size.

parameters.description: The requested page.

post.description: Create an OutboundSetupIntent object.

payout_method.description:
If provided, the existing payout method resource to link to this setup intent.
Any payout_method_data provided is used to update information on this linked payout method resource.

type.description: Closed Enum. The type of payout method to be created.

account_number.description: The account number or IBAN of the bank account.

bank_account_type.description: Closed Enum. The type of the bank account (checking or savings).

branch_number.description: The branch number of the bank account, if present.

country.description: The country code of the bank account.

routing_number.description: The routing number of the bank account, if present.

swift_code.description: The swift code of the bank account, if present.

bank_account.description: The type specific details of the bank account payout method.

exp_month.description: The expiration month of the card.

exp_year.description: The expiration year of the card.

card.description: The type specific details of the card payout method.

payout_method_data.description:
If no payout_method provided, used to create the underlying credential that is set up for outbound money movement.
If a payout_method provided, used to update data on the credential linked to this setup intent.

usage_intent.description:
Specify which type of outbound money movement this credential should be set up for (payment | transfer).
If not provided, defaults to payment.

Archive a USBankAccount object. USBankAccount objects will not be automatically archived by Stripe.

An internal key you can use to search for a particular billing profile. It must be unique among billing profiles for a given customer.

post.description:
Initiate Confirmation of Payee (CoP) in order to verify that the owner of a UK bank account matches
who you expect. This must be done on all UK bank accounts before sending domestic OutboundPayments. If
the result is a partial match or a non match, explicit acknowledgement using AcknowledgeConfirmationOfPayee
is required before sending funds.

parameters.description: The GBBankAccount for which to perform Confirmation of Payee.

name.description: The name of the user to be checked against. Legal entity information will be used if unspecified.

post.description: Removes access to the Account and its associated resources. Closed Accounts can no longer be operated on, but limited information can still be retrieved through the API in order to be able to track their history.

collection_method.description:
Either automatic, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this
bill at the end of the period using the payment method attached to the payer profile. When sending an invoice,
Stripe will email your payer profile an invoice with payment instructions.

display_name.description:
An optional customer-facing display name for the CollectionSetting object.
To remove the display name, set it to an empty string in the request.
Maximum length of 250 characters.

enabled.description: If true an email for the invoice would be generated and sent out.

include_payment_link.description: If true the payment link to hosted invoice page would be included in email and PDF of the invoice.

payment_due.description: Controls emails for when the payment is due. For example after the invoice is finalized and transitions to Open state.

live_version.description:
Optionally change the live version of the CollectionSetting. Billing Cadences and other objects that refer to this
CollectionSetting will use this version when no overrides are set. Providing `live_version = "latest"` will set the
CollectionSetting's `live_version` to its latest version.

lookup_key.description:
A lookup key used to retrieve settings dynamically from a static string.
This may be up to 200 characters.

payment_method_configuration.description: The ID of the PaymentMethodConfiguration object, which controls which payment methods are displayed to your customers.

acss_debit.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Canadian pre-authorized debit payment method options.

preferred_language.description: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to.

bancontact.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method.

amount.description: Amount to be charged for future payments.

amount_type.description: The AmountType for the mandate. One of `fixed` or `maximum`.

description.description: A description of the mandate that is meant to be displayed to the customer.

mandate_options.description: Configuration options for setting up an eMandate for cards issued in India.

network.description: Selected network to process the payment on. Depends on the available networks of the card.

request_three_d_secure.description:
An advanced option 3D Secure. We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers
for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/strong-customer-authentication).
However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option.
Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](https://docs.stripe.com/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

card.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Card payment method options.

country.description: The desired country code of the bank account information.

eu_bank_transfer.description: Configuration for `eu_bank_transfer` funding type. Required if `type` is `eu_bank_transfer`.

type.description: The bank transfer type that can be used for funding.

bank_transfer.description: Configuration for the bank transfer funding type, if the `funding_type` is set to `bank_transfer`.

funding_type.description: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Currently the only supported value is `bank_transfer`.

customer_balance.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Bank transfer payment method options.

konbini.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Konbini payment method options.

sepa_debit.description: This sub-hash contains details about the SEPA Direct Debit payment method options.

account_subcategories.description: The account subcategories to use to filter for selectable accounts.

filters.description: Provide filters for the linked accounts that the customer can select for the payment method.

permissions.description: The list of permissions to request. If this parameter is passed, the `payment_method` permission must be included.

prefetch.description: List of data features that you would like to retrieve upon account creation.

financial_connections.description: Additional fields for Financial Connections Session creation.

us_bank_account.description: This sub-hash contains details about the ACH direct debit payment method options.

payment_method_options.description: Payment Method specific configuration to be stored on the object.

get.description: Retrieve a BillingProfile object.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the billing profile to Retrieve.

post.description: Update a BillingProfile object.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the billing profile to update.

default_payment_method.description: The ID of the payment method object.

display_name.description:
A customer-facing name for the billing profile.
Maximum length of 250 characters.
To remove the display_name from the object, set it to null in the request.

lookup_key.description:
An internal key you can use to search for a particular billing profile. It must be unique among billing profiles for a given customer.
Maximum length of 200 characters.
To remove the lookup_key from the object, set it to null in the request.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

post.description: Creates an OutboundPaymentQuote usable in an OutboundPayment.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The "presentment amount" to be sent to the recipient.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Method to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

currency.description: Describes the FinancialAccount's currency drawn from.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: Request details about the sender of an OutboundPaymentQuote.

currency.description:
Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: Request details about the recipient of an OutboundPaymentQuote.

parameters.description: Optionally filter by verification status. Mutually exclusive with `unverified`, `verified`, `awaiting_verification`, and `verification_failed`.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Create a USBankAccount object.

account_number.description: The account number of the bank account.

bank_account_type.description: Closed Enum. The type of the bank account (checking or savings).

fedwire_routing_number.description: The fedwire routing number of the bank account. Note that certain banks have the same ACH and wire routing number.

routing_number.description: The ACH routing number of the bank account. Note that certain banks have the same ACH and wire routing number.

parameters.name: created_gte
parameters.description: Filter for Transactions created at or after the specified timestamp.

parameters.name: created_lt
parameters.description: Filter for Transactions created before the specified timestamp.

parameters.name: created_lte
parameters.description: Filter for Transactions created at or before the specified timestamp.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page limit.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token.

parameters.name: transaction
parameters.description: Filter for TransactionEntries belonging to a Transaction.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

account_number.description: The Account Number of the bank account.

bank_account_type.description: Closed Enum. The type of the bank account (checking or savings).

business_type.description:
The business type to be checked against. Legal entity information will be used if unspecified.
Closed enum.

initiate.description: User specifies whether Confirmation of Payee is automatically initiated when creating the bank account.

name.description: The name to be checked against. Legal entity information will be used if unspecified.

confirmation_of_payee.description:
Whether or not to automatically perform Confirmation of Payee to verify the users information
against what was provided by the bank. Doing so is required for all bank accounts not owned
by you before making domestic UK OutboundPayments.

sort_code.description: The Sort Code of the bank account.

post.description:
Archive a PayoutMethod object. Archived objects cannot be used as payout methods
and will not appear in the payout method list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the payout method.

post.summary: Create a billing meter event with synchronous validation
post.description: Creates a meter event. Events are validated synchronously, but are processed asynchronously. Supports up to 1,000 events per second in livemode. For higher rate-limits, please use meter event streams instead.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier for the event. If not provided, one will be generated.
We recommend using a globally unique identifier for this. We’ll enforce
uniqueness within a rolling 24 hour period.

payload.description:
The payload of the event. This must contain the fields corresponding to a meter’s
`customer_mapping.event_payload_key` (default is `stripe_customer_id`) and
`value_settings.event_payload_key` (default is `value`). Read more about
the
[payload](https://docs.stripe.com/billing/subscriptions/usage-based/recording-usage#payload-key-overrides).

timestamp.description:
The time of the event. Must be within the past 35 calendar days or up to
5 minutes in the future. Defaults to current timestamp if not specified.

applied.description: Represents the state of the configuration, and can be updated to deactivate or re-apply a configuration.

exempt.description: The customer account's tax exemption status: `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When `reverse`, invoice and receipt PDFs include "Reverse charge".

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

location_source.description: Data source used to identify the customer account's tax location. Defaults to `identity_address`. Used for automatic indirect tax calculation.

validate_location.description: A per-request flag that indicates when Stripe should validate the customer tax location - defaults to `auto`.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Automatic indirect tax settings to be used when automatic tax calculation is enabled on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, checkout sessions, or payment links. Surfaces if automatic tax calculation is possible given the current customer location information.

default_payment_method.description: ID of a PaymentMethod attached to the customer account to use as the default for invoices and subscriptions.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

next_sequence.description: Sequence number to use on the customer account's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: Prefix used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3-12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: Indicates whether displayed line item prices and amounts on invoice PDFs include inclusive tax amounts. Must be either `include_inclusive_tax` or `exclude_tax`.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

invoice.description: Default invoice settings for the customer account.

billing.description: Billing settings - default settings used for this customer in Billing flows such as Invoices and Subscriptions.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

get.description: Returns a list of OutboundPayments that match the provided filters.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created at the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token to use to retrieve the page being requested.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: Only return OutboundPayments sent to this recipient.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Closed Enum. Only return OutboundPayments with this status.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Creates an OutboundPayment.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The "presentment amount" to be sent to the recipient.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Delivery options to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the OutboundPayment. Often useful for displaying to users.

currency.description: Describes the FinancialAmount's currency drawn from.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: From which FinancialAccount and BalanceType to pull funds from.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

outbound_payment_quote.description: The quote for this OutboundPayment. Only required for countries with regulatory mandates to display fee estimates before OutboundPayment creation.

setting.description:
Closed Enum. Configuration option to enable or disable notifications to recipients.
Do not send notifications when setting is NONE. Default to account setting when setting is CONFIGURED or not set.

recipient_notification.description: Details about the notification settings for the OutboundPayment recipient.

currency.description:
Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: To which payout method to send the OutboundPayment.

post.summary: Create billing meter event stream authentication session
post.description: Creates a meter event session to send usage on the high-throughput meter event stream. Authentication tokens are only valid for 15 minutes, so you will need to create a new meter event session when your token expires.

get.description: List all CollectionSetting objects.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optionally set the maximum number of results per page. Defaults to 20.

parameters.name: lookup_keys
parameters.description:
Only return the settings with these lookup_keys, if any exist.
You can specify up to 10 lookup_keys.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Opaque page token.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Create a CollectionSetting object.

collection_method.description:
Either automatic, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this
bill at the end of the period using the payment method attached to the payer profile. When sending an invoice,
Stripe will email your payer profile an invoice with payment instructions.
Defaults to automatic.

display_name.description:
An optional customer-facing display name for the CollectionSetting object.
Maximum length of 250 characters.

enabled.description: If true an email for the invoice would be generated and sent out.

include_payment_link.description: If true the payment link to hosted invoice page would be included in email and PDF of the invoice.

payment_due.description: Controls emails for when the payment is due. For example after the invoice is finalized and transitions to Open state.

lookup_key.description:
A lookup key used to retrieve settings dynamically from a static string.
This may be up to 200 characters.

payment_method_configuration.description: The ID of the PaymentMethodConfiguration object, which controls which payment methods are displayed to your customers.

acss_debit.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Canadian pre-authorized debit payment method options.

preferred_language.description: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to.

bancontact.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method.

amount.description: Amount to be charged for future payments.

amount_type.description: The AmountType for the mandate. One of `fixed` or `maximum`.

description.description: A description of the mandate that is meant to be displayed to the customer.

mandate_options.description: Configuration options for setting up an eMandate for cards issued in India.

network.description: Selected network to process the payment on. Depends on the available networks of the card.

request_three_d_secure.description:
An advanced option 3D Secure. We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers
for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/strong-customer-authentication).
However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option.
Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](https://docs.stripe.com/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

card.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Card payment method options.

country.description: The desired country code of the bank account information.

eu_bank_transfer.description: Configuration for `eu_bank_transfer` funding type. Required if `type` is `eu_bank_transfer`.

type.description: The bank transfer type that can be used for funding.

bank_transfer.description: Configuration for the bank transfer funding type, if the `funding_type` is set to `bank_transfer`.

funding_type.description: The funding method type to be used when there are not enough funds in the customer balance. Currently the only supported value is `bank_transfer`.

customer_balance.description: This sub-hash contains details about the Bank transfer payment method options.

get.summary: Retrieve bank account specification by country
get.description:
Fetch the specifications for a set of countries to know which
credential fields are required, the validations for each fields, and how to translate these
country-specific fields to the generic fields in the PayoutMethodBankAccount type.

parameters.description: The countries to fetch the bank account spec for.

parameters.description: The ID of the USBankAccount object.

fedwire_routing_number.description: The bank account's fedwire routing number can be provided for update it was were empty previously.

get.description: Retrieves a list of ReceivedCredits.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created at the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page limit.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

get.description: Retrieve a CollectionSetting Version by ID.

parameters.name: collection_setting_id
parameters.description: The ID of the CollectionSetting that has the version.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the CollectionSettingVersion.

get.description: List events, going back up to 30 days.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Set of filters to query events within a range of `created` timestamps.

gt.description: Filter for events created after the specified timestamp.

gte.description: Filter for events created at or after the specified timestamp.

lt.description: Filter for events created before the specified timestamp.

lte.description: Filter for events created at or before the specified timestamp.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The page size.

parameters.name: object_id
parameters.description: Primary object ID used to retrieve related events.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The requested page.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: An array of up to 20 strings containing specific event names.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

parameters.description: The ID of the OutboundPaymentQuote to retrieve.

v2.billing.bill_setting.title: The bill setting object

type.description: Determines if tax will be calculated automatically based on a PTC or manually based on rules defined by the merchant. Defaults to "manual".

calculation.description: Settings related to calculating a bill.

created.description: Timestamp of when the object was created.

display_name.description: An optional field for adding a display name for the BillSetting object.

id.description: The ID of the BillSetting object.

interval.description: The interval unit for the time until due.

interval_count.description:
The number of interval units. For example, if interval=day and interval_count=30,
the invoice will be due in 30 days.

time_until_due.description: The amount of time until the invoice will be overdue for payment.

invoice_rendering_template.description: The ID of the invoice rendering template to be used when generating invoices.

latest_version.description:
The latest version of the current settings object. This will be
Updated every time an attribute of the settings is updated.

live_version.description:
The current live version of the settings object. This can be different from
latest_version if settings are updated without setting live_version='latest'.

lookup_key.description:
A lookup key used to retrieve settings dynamically from a static string.
This may be up to 200 characters.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.billing.bill_setting.description: BillSetting is responsible for settings which dictate generating bills, which include settings for calculating totals on bills, tax on bill items, as well as how to generate and present invoices.

type.description: Determines if tax will be calculated automatically based on a PTC or manually based on rules defined by the merchant. Defaults to "manual".

calculation.description: Settings related to calculating a bill.

created.description: Timestamp of when the object was created.

id.description: The ID of the BillSettingVersion object.

interval.description: The interval unit for the time until due.

interval_count.description:
The number of interval units. For example, if interval=day and interval_count=30,
the invoice will be due in 30 days.

time_until_due.description: The amount of time until the invoice will be overdue for payment.

invoice_rendering_template.description: The ID of the invoice rendering template to be used when generating invoices.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

interval_count.description: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between cadence billings. For example, type=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

type.description: The frequency at which a cadence bills.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description: The time at which the billing cycle ends.

day.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=day.

day_of_month.description:
The day to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from 1-31.
If this number is greater than the number of days in the month being billed,
this will anchor to the last day of the month.

month_of_year.description:
The month to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from
1-12. Occurrences are calculated from the month anchor.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description: The time at which the billing cycle ends.

month.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=month.

day_of_week.description:
The day of the week to bill the type=week billing cycle on.
Numbered from 1-7 for Monday to Sunday respectively, based on the ISO-8601 week day numbering.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.
0 represents midnight, and 23 represents 11 PM.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

second.description:
The second at which the billing cycle ends.
Must be an integer between 0 and 59, inclusive.

time.description: The time at which the billing cycle ends.

week.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=week.

day_of_month.description:
The day to anchor the billing on for a type="month" billing cycle from 1-31.
If this number is greater than the number of days in the month being billed,
this will anchor to the last day of the month.

month_of_year.description: The month to bill on from 1-12. If not provided, this will default to the month the cadence was created.

hour.description:
The hour at which the billing cycle ends.
This must be an integer between 0 and 23, inclusive.

minute.description:
The minute at which the billing cycle ends.

second.description:

year.description: Specific configuration for determining billing dates when type=year.

payer.description: The payer determines the entity financially responsible for the bill.

settings.description: The settings associated with the cadence.

type.description: Determines if tax will be calculated automatically based on a PTC or manually based on rules defined by the merchant. Defaults to "manual".

calculation.description: Settings related to calculating a bill.

interval.description: The interval unit for the time until due.

The number of interval units. For example, if interval=day and interval_count=30,

collection_method.description:
Either automatic, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this
bill at the end of the period using the payment method attached to the payer profile. When sending an invoice,
Stripe will email your payer profile an invoice with payment instructions.
Defaults to automatic.

enabled.description: If true an email for the invoice would be generated and sent out.

include_payment_link.description: If true the payment link to hosted invoice page would be included in email and PDF of the invoice.

payment_due.description: Controls emails for when the payment is due. For example after the invoice is finalized and transitions to Open state.

network.description: Selected network to process the payment on. Depends on the available networks of the card.

request_three_d_secure.description:
An advanced option 3D Secure. We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers
for authentication based on risk level and [other requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/strong-customer-authentication).
However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option.
Read our guide on [manually requesting 3D Secure](https://docs.stripe.com/payments/3d-secure/authentication-flow#manual-three-ds) for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine.

created.description: The creation time of this meter event.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the event. If not provided, one will be generated. We recommend using a globally unique identifier for this. We’ll enforce uniqueness within a rolling 24 hour period.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

payload.description:
The payload of the event. This must contain the fields corresponding to a meter’s
`customer_mapping.event_payload_key` (default is `stripe_customer_id`) and
`value_settings.event_payload_key` (default is `value`). Read more about
the [payload](https://docs.stripe.com/billing/subscriptions/usage-based/recording-usage#payload-key-overrides)..

timestamp.description:
The time of the event. Must be within the past 35 calendar days or up to
5 minutes in the future. Defaults to current timestamp if not specified.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

identifier.description: Unique identifier for the event. You can only cancel events within 24 hours of Stripe receiving them.

created.description: The time the adjustment was created.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

id.description: The unique id of this meter event adjustment.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

status.description: Open Enum. The meter event adjustment’s status.

type.description: Open Enum. Specifies whether to cancel a single event or a range of events for a time period. Time period cancellation is not supported yet.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

authentication_token.description:
The authentication token for this session.  Use this token when calling the
high-throughput meter event API.

created.description: The creation time of this session.

expires_at.description: The time at which this session will expire.

id.description: The unique id of this auth session.

display_name.description:
A customer-facing name for the billing profile.
Maximum length of 250 characters.
