lookup_key.description:
An internal key you can use to search for a particular billing profile.
Maximum length of 200 characters.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

status.description: The current status of the billing profile.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.core.account.title: The account object

applied_configurations.description: The configurations that have been applied to this account.

closed.description: Indicates whether the account has been closed.

applied.description: Indicates whether the customer configuration is active. You can deactivate or reactivate the customer configuration by updating this property. Deactivating the configuration by setting this value to false will unrequest all capabilities within the configuration. It will not delete any of the configuration's other properties.

exempt.description: The customer account's tax exemption status: `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When `reverse`, invoice and receipt PDFs include "Reverse charge".

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

country.description: The identified tax country of the customer.

state.description: The identified tax state, county, province, or region of the customer.

location.description: The customer account's identified tax location, derived from `location_source`. Only rendered if the `automatic_indirect_tax` feature is requested and `active`.

location_source.description: Data source used to identify the customer account's tax location. Defaults to `identity_address`. Used for automatic indirect tax calculation.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Settings for automatic indirect tax calculation on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, Checkout Sessions, and Payment Links. Available when automatic tax calculation is available for the customer account's location.

default_payment_method.description: ID of a PaymentMethod attached to the customer account to use as the default for invoices and subscriptions.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined fields.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

next_sequence.description: Sequence number to use on the customer account's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: Prefix used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3-12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: Indicates whether displayed line item prices and amounts on invoice PDFs include inclusive tax amounts. Must be either `include_inclusive_tax` or `exclude_tax`.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

invoice.description: Default invoice settings for the customer account.

billing.description: Default Billing settings for the customer account, used in Invoices and Subscriptions.

status_details.description: Additional details about the capability's status. This value is empty when `status` is `active`.

code.description: Machine-readable code explaining the reason for the Capability to be in its current status.

resolution.description: Machine-readable code explaining how to make the Capability active.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Customer Configuration.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

phone.description: Customer phone (including extension).

shipping.description: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

test_clock.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer. Can only be set on testmode Accounts, and when the Customer Configuration is first set on an Account.

customer.description: The Customer Configuration allows the Account to be used in inbound payment flows.

applied.description: Indicates whether the merchant configuration is active. You can deactivate or reactivate the merchant configuration by updating this property. Deactivating the configuration by setting this value to false doesn't delete the configuration's properties.

display_name.description: Display name for Bacs Direct Debit payments.

service_user_number.description: Service User Number (SUN) for Bacs Direct Debit payments.

bacs_debit_payments.description: Settings for Bacs Direct Debit payments.

icon.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): An icon for the merchant. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

logo.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): A logo for the merchant that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the merchant's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

primary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for the merchant.

secondary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for the merchant.

branding.description: Settings used to apply the merchant's branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

avs_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

email.description: Support email address for Konbini payments.

phone.description: Support phone number for Konbini payments.

konbini_payments.description: Settings specific to Konbini payments on the account.

mcc.description: The Merchant Category Code (MCC) for the merchant. MCCs classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

kana.description: The Kana variation of statement_descriptor used for charges in Japan. Japanese statement descriptors have [special requirements](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#set-japanese-statement-descriptors).

merchant.description: Enables the Account to act as a connected account and collect payments facilitated by a Connect platform. You must onboard your platform to Connect before you can add this configuration to your connected accounts. Utilize this configuration when the Account will be the Merchant of Record, like with Direct charges or Destination Charges with on_behalf_of set.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Storer Configuration.

storer.description: The Storer Configuration allows the Account to store and move funds using stored-value FinancialAccounts.

configuration.description: An Account represents a company, individual, or other entity that a user interacts with. Accounts store identity information and one or more configurations that enable product-specific capabilities. You can assign configurations at creation or add them later.

contact_email.description: The default contact email address for the Account. Required when configuring the account as a merchant or recipient.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

dashboard.description: A value indicating the Stripe dashboard this Account has access to. This will depend on which configurations are enabled for this account.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

locales.description: The Account's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

product_description.description: Internal-only description of the product sold or service provided by the business. It's used by Stripe for risk and underwriting purposes.

fees_collector.description: Indicates whether the platform or connected account is responsible for paying Stripe fees for pricing-control-eligible products.

losses_collector.description: A value indicating responsibility for collecting requirements on this account.

requirements_collector.description: A value indicating responsibility for collecting requirements on this account.

responsibilities.description: Default responsibilities held by either Stripe or the platform.

defaults.description: Default values for settings shared across Account configurations.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the Account. This name will be surfaced in the Stripe Dashboard and on any invoices sent to the Account.

entries.description: A list of requirements for the Account.

awaiting_action_from.description: Indicates whether the platform or Stripe is currently responsible for taking action on the requirement. Value can be `user` or `stripe`.

description.description: Machine-readable string describing the requirement.

errors.description: Descriptions of why the requirement must be collected, or why the collected information isn't satisfactory to Stripe.

code.description: Machine-readable code describing the error.

description.description: Human-readable description of the error.

restricts_capabilities.description: The Capabilities that will be restricted if the requirement is not collected and satisfactory to Stripe.

capability.description: The name of the Capability which will be restricted.

configuration.description: The configuration which specifies the Capability which will be restricted.

status.description: The current status of the requirement's impact.

deadline.description: Details about when in the account lifecycle the requirement must be collected by the avoid the Capability restriction.

impact.description: A hash describing the impact of not collecting the requirement, or Stripe not being able to verify the collected information.

status.description: The current status of the requirement's impact.

minimum_deadline.description: The soonest point when the account will be impacted by not providing the requirement.

inquiry.description: If `inquiry` is the type, the inquiry token.

resource.description: If `resource` is the type, the resource token.

type.description:
The type of the reference. If the type is "inquiry", the inquiry token can be found in the "inquiry" field.
Otherwise the type is an API resource, the token for which can be found in the "resource" field.

reference.description: A reference to the location of the requirement.

requested_reasons.description: A list of reasons why Stripe is collecting the requirement.

code.description: Machine-readable description of Stripe's reason for collecting the requirement.

minimum_transition_date.description: The time at which the future requirements become effective.

status.description: The current strictest status of all requirements on the Account.

time.description: The soonest RFC3339 date & time UTC value a requirement can impact the Account.

minimum_deadline.description: The soonest date and time a requirement on the Account will become `past due`. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: `2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z`.

summary.description: An object containing an overview of requirements for the Account.

future_requirements.description: Information about the future requirements for the Account that will eventually come into effect, including what information needs to be collected, and by when.

date.description: The time marking when the director attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the director attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the director attestation was made.

directorship_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the directors information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

ownership_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

executives.description: Whether the company’s executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s executives with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

owners.description: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s owners with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

ownership_exemption_reason.description: Reason for why the company is exempt from providing ownership information.

persons_provided.description: Attestation that all Persons with a specific Relationship value have been provided.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the representative attestation was made.

representative_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the representative is authorized to act as the representative of their legal entity.

v2.core.account.description: A V2 Account is a representation of a company or individual that a Stripe user does business with. Accounts contain the contact details, Legal Entity information, and configuration required to enable the Account for use across Stripe products.

v2.core.account_link.title: The account link object

account.description: The ID of the connected account this Account Link applies to.

created.description: The timestamp at which this Account Link was created.

expires_at.description: The timestamp at which this Account Link will expire.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

url.description: The URL at which the account can access the Stripe-hosted flow.

type.description: Open Enum. The type of Account Link the user is requesting.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). If you don’t specify collection_options, the default value is currently_due.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

collection_options.description: Specifies the requirements that Stripe collects from v2/core/accounts in the Onboarding flow.

configurations.description: Open Enum. A v2/core/account can be configured to enable certain functionality. The configuration param targets the v2/core/account_link to collect information for the specified v2/core/account configuration/s.

refresh_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to if the AccountLink is expired, has been used, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new AccountLink with the same parameters used to create the original AccountLink, then redirect the user to the new AccountLink’s URL so they can continue the flow. If a new AccountLink cannot be generated or the redirect fails you should display a useful error to the user. Please make sure to implement authentication before redirecting the user in case this URL is leaked to a third party.

return_url.description: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon completing the linked flow.

account_onboarding.description: Hash containing configuration options for an Account Link object that onboards a new account.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). The default value is `currently_due`.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

collection_options.description: Specifies the requirements that Stripe collects from v2/core/accounts in the Onboarding flow.

configurations.description: Open Enum. A v2/account can be configured to enable certain functionality. The configuration param targets the v2/account_link to collect information for the specified v2/account configuration/s.

refresh_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to if the Account Link is expired, has been used, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new Account Link with the same parameters used to create the original Account Link, then redirect the user to the new Account Link URL so they can continue the flow. Make sure to authenticate the user before redirecting to the new Account Link, in case the URL leaks to a third party. If a new Account Link can't be generated, or if the redirect fails, you should display a useful error to the user.

return_url.description: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon completing the linked flow.

account_update.description: Hash containing configuration options for an Account Link that updates an existing account.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.core.account_link.description: Account Links let a platform create a temporary, single-use URL that an account can use to access a Stripe-hosted flow for collecting or updating required information.

use_case.description: Open Enum. The use case type of the account link that has been completed.

account_id.description: The ID of the v2 account.

configurations.description: Configurations on the Account that was onboarded via the account link.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.core.account_link.returned.description: Occurs when the generated AccountLink is completed.

v2.core.event.description: Events are generated to keep you informed of activity in your business account. APIs in the /v2 namespace generate [thin events](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#benefits-of-thin-events) which have small, unversioned payloads that include a reference to the ID of the object that has changed. The Events v2 API returns these new thin events. [Retrieve the event object](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#fetch-data) for additional data about the event. Use the related object ID in the event payload to [fetch the API resource](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#retrieve-the-object-associated-with-thin-events) of the object associated with the event. Comparatively, events generated by most API v1 include a versioned snapshot of an API object in their payload.

Event destinations support receiving [thin events](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/events) and [snapshot events](https://docs.stripe.com/api/events).

v2.core.vault.gb_bank_account.title: The gb bank account object

archived.description:
Whether this bank account object was archived. Bank account objects can be archived through
the /archive API, and they will not be automatically archived by Stripe. Archived bank account objects
cannot be used as outbound destinations and will not appear in the outbound destination list.

bank_account_type.description: Closed Enum. The type of the bank account (checking or savings).

created.description: When the CoP result was created.

match_result.description: Whether or not the information of the bank account matches what you have provided. Closed enum.

business_type.description:
The business type given by the bank for this account, in case of a MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH.
Closed enum.

name.description: The name given by the bank for this account, in case of a MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH.

matched.description: The fields that CoP service matched against. Only has value if MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH, empty otherwise.

message.description: Human-readable message describing the match result.

business_type.description: The provided or Legal Entity business type to match against the CoP service. Closed enum.

name.description: The provided or Legal Entity name to match against the CoP service.

provided.description: The fields that are matched against what the network has on file.

result.description: The result of the Confirmation of Payee check, once the check has been initiated. Closed enum.

status.description: The current state of Confirmation of Payee on this bank account. Closed enum.

confirmation_of_payee.description:
Information around the status of Confirmation of Payee matching done on this bank account.
Confirmation of Payee is a name matching service that must be done before making OutboundPayments in the UK.

created.description: Creation time.

id.description: The ID of the GBBankAccount object.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number or IBAN.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

sort_code.description: The Sort Code of the bank account.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The amount of the Adjustment.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

available.description: Balance that can be used for money movement.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

country.description: Open Enum. Two-letter country code that represents the country where the LegalEntity associated with the FinancialAccount is based in.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the FinancialAccount, up to 50 characters long. This name will be used in the Stripe Dashboard and embedded components.

type.description: The type of the FinancialAccount, represented as a string. Upgrade your API version to see the type reflected in `financial_account.type`.

other.description: If this is a `other` FinancialAccount, this hash indicates what the actual type is. Upgrade your API version to see it reflected in `type`.

payment_method.description: The address to send forwarded payments to.

payout_method.description: The address to send forwarded payouts to.

storage.description: If this is a `storage` FinancialAccount, this hash includes details specific to `storage` FinancialAccounts.

v2.money_management.outbound_payment.title: The outbound payment object

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The "presentment amount" for the OutboundPayment.

cancelable.description: Returns true if the OutboundPayment can be canceled, and false otherwise.

created.description:
Time at which the OutboundPayment was created.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Delivery options to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the OutboundPayment. Often useful for displaying to users.

expected_arrival_date.description:
The date when funds are expected to arrive in the payout method. This field is not set if the payout method is in a `failed`, `canceled`, or `returned` state.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

debited.description: The monetary amount debited from the sender, only set on responses.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

outbound_payment_quote.description: The quote for this OutboundPayment. Only required for countries with regulatory mandates to display fee estimates before OutboundPayment creation.

receipt_url.description: A link to the Stripe-hosted receipt for this OutboundPayment. The receipt link remains active for 60 days from the OutboundPayment creation date. After this period, the link will expire and the receipt url value will be null.

setting.description:
Closed Enum. Configuration option to enable or disable notifications to recipients.
Do not send notifications when setting is NONE. Default to account setting when setting is CONFIGURED or not set.

recipient_notification.description: Details about the OutboundPayment notification settings for recipient.

statement_descriptor.description: The description that appears on the receiving end for an OutboundPayment (for example, bank statement for external bank transfer). It will default to `STRIPE` if not set on the account settings.

status.description:
Closed Enum. Current status of the OutboundPayment: `processing`, `failed`, `posted`, `returned`, `canceled`.
An OutboundPayment is `processing` if it has been created and is processing.
The status changes to `posted` once the OutboundPayment has been "confirmed" and funds have left the account, or to `failed` or `canceled`.
If an OutboundPayment fails to arrive at its payout method, its status will change to `returned`.

status_details.description: Status details for an OutboundPayment in a `failed` or `returned` state.

canceled_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `canceled`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

failed_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `failed`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

posted_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `posted`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

returned_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `returned`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

status_transitions.description: Hash containing timestamps of when the object transitioned to a particular status.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

credited.description: The monetary amount being credited to the destination.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: To which payout method the OutboundPayment was sent.

status.description:
Possible values are `pending`, `supported`, and `unsupported`. Initially set to `pending`, it changes to
`supported` when the recipient bank provides a trace ID, or `unsupported` if the recipient bank doesn't support it.
Note that this status may not align with the OutboundPayment or OutboundTransfer status and can remain `pending`
even after the payment or transfer is posted.

value.description: The trace ID value if `trace_id.status` is `supported`, otherwise empty.

trace_id.description: A unique identifier that can be used to track this OutboundPayment with recipient bank. Banks might call this a “reference number” or something similar.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

receipt_url.description: A link to the Stripe-hosted receipt for this OutboundTransfer. The receipt link remains active for 60 days from the OutboundTransfer creation date. After this period, the link will expire and the receipt url value will be null.

statement_descriptor.description: The description that appears on the receiving end for an OutboundTransfer (for example, bank statement for external bank transfer). It will default to `STRIPE` if not set on the account settings.

status.description:
Closed Enum. Current status of the OutboundTransfer: `processing`, `failed`, `posted`, `returned`, `canceled`.
An OutboundTransfer is `processing` if it has been created and is processing.
The status changes to `posted` once the OutboundTransfer has been "confirmed" and funds have left the account, or to `failed` or `canceled`.
If an OutboundTransfer fails to arrive at its payout method, its status will change to `returned`.

status_details.description: Status details for an OutboundTransfer in a `failed` or `returned` state.

canceled_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to `canceled`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

failed_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to `failed`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

posted_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to `posted`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

returned_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundTransfer changed status to `returned`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

status_transitions.description: Hash containing timestamps of when the object transitioned to a particular status.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

credited.description: The monetary amount being credited to the destination.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundTransfer uses to send payout.

to.description: To which payout method the OutboundTransfer was sent.

status.description:
Possible values are `pending`, `supported`, and `unsupported`. Initially set to `pending`, it changes to
`supported` when the recipient bank provides a trace ID, or `unsupported` if the recipient bank doesn't support it.
Note that this status may not align with the OutboundPayment or OutboundTransfer status and can remain `pending`
even after the payment or transfer is posted.

value.description: The trace ID value if `trace_id.status` is `supported`, otherwise empty.

trace_id.description: A unique identifier that can be used to track this OutboundTransfer with recipient bank. Banks might call this a “reference number” or something similar.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

created.description: Created timestamp.

latest_outbound_setup_intent.description: ID of the underlying active OutboundSetupIntent object, if any.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

type.description: Closed Enum. The type of payout method.

payments.description: Payments status - used when sending OutboundPayments (sending funds to recipients).

transfers.description: Transfers status - used when making an OutboundTransfer (sending funds to yourself).

usage_status.description: Indicates whether the payout method has met the necessary requirements for outbound money movement.

archived.description:
Whether this PayoutMethodBankAccount object was archived. PayoutMethodBankAccount objects can be archived through
the /archive API, and they will not be automatically archived by Stripe. Archived PayoutMethodBankAccount objects
cannot be used as payout methods and will not appear in the payout method list.

bank_account_type.description: The type of bank account (checking or savings).

bank_name.description: The name of the bank this bank account is in. This field is populated automatically by Stripe.

country.description: The country code of the bank account.

enabled_delivery_options.description: List of enabled flows for this bank account (wire or local).

financial_connections_account.description: The ID of the Financial Connections Account used to create the bank account.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number.

routing_number.description: The routing number of the bank account, if present.

supported_currencies.description: The list of currencies supported by this bank account.

archived.description:
Whether the PayoutMethodCard object was archived. PayoutMethodCard objects can be archived through
the /archive API, and they will not be automatically archived by Stripe. Archived PayoutMethodCard objects
cannot be used as payout methods and will not appear in the payout method list.

v2.money_management.received_credit.title: The received credit object

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The amount and currency of the ReceivedCredit.

created.description:
Time at which the ReceivedCredit was created.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

description.description: Freeform string set by originator of the ReceivedCredit.

financial_account.description: Financial Account ID on which funds for ReceivedCredit were received.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

receipt_url.description: A hosted transaction receipt URL that is provided when money movement is considered regulated under Stripe’s money transmission licenses.

status.description: Open Enum. The status of the ReceivedCredit.

failed.description: Hash that provides additional information regarding the reason behind a `failed` ReceivedCredit status. It is only present when the ReceivedCredit status is `failed`.

returned.description: Hash that provides additional information regarding the reason behind a `returned` ReceivedCredit status. It is only present when the ReceivedCredit status is `returned`.

status_details.description: This hash contains detailed information that elaborates on the specific status of the ReceivedCredit. e.g the reason behind a failure if the status is marked as `failed`.

failed_at.description:
Timestamp describing when the ReceivedCredit was marked as `failed`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

returned_at.description:
Timestamp describing when the ReceivedCredit changed status to `returned`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

succeeded_at.description:
Timestamp describing when the ReceivedCredit was marked as `succeeded`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

status_transitions.description: Hash containing timestamps of when the object transitioned to a particular status.

type.description: Open Enum. The type of flow that caused the ReceivedCredit.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

from_account.description: The ID of the account that owns the source object originated the ReceivedCredit.

type.description: Open Enum. The type of Stripe Money Movement that originated the ReceivedCredit.

outbound_payment.description: The ID of the outbound payment object that originated the ReceivedCredit.

outbound_transfer.description: The ID of the outbound transfer object that originated the ReceivedCredit.

payout_v1.description: The ID of the payout object that originated the ReceivedCredit.

transfer.description: The ID of the v1 transfer object that originated the ReceivedCredit.

balance_transfer.description: This object stores details about the originating Stripe transaction that resulted in the ReceivedCredit. Present if `type` field value is `balance_transfer`.

financial_address.description: Financial Address on which funds for ReceivedCredit were received.

origin_type.description: Open Enum. Indicates the origin of source from which external funds originated from.

statement_descriptor.description: Freeform string set by originator of the external ReceivedCredit.

account_holder_name.description: The bank name the transfer was received from.

bank_name.description: The bank name the transfer was received from.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number that originated the transfer.

network.description: Open Enum. The money transmission network used to send funds for this ReceivedCredit.

sort_code.description: The sort code of the account that originated the transfer.

gb_bank_account.description: Hash containing the transaction bank details. Present if `origin_type` field value is `gb_bank_account`.

account_holder_name.description: The account holder name of the bank account the transfer was received from.

bank_name.description: The bank name the transfer was received from.

bic.description: The BIC of the SEPA account.

country.description: The origination country of the bank transfer.

iban.description: The IBAN that originated the transfer.

network.description: The money transmission network used to send funds for this ReceivedCredit.

sepa_bank_account.description: Hash containing the transaction bank details. Present if `origin_type` field value is `sepa_bank_account`.

bank_name.description: The bank name the transfer was received from.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number that originated the transfer.

network.description: Open Enum. The money transmission network used to send funds for this ReceivedCredit.

routing_number.description: The routing number of the account that originated the transfer.

us_bank_account.description: Hash containing the transaction bank details. Present if `origin_type` field value is `us_bank_account`.

bank_transfer.description: This object stores details about the originating banking transaction that resulted in the ReceivedCredit. Present if `type` field value is `bank_transfer`.

v2.money_management.transaction.title: The transaction object

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The amount of the Transaction.

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

value.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

balance_impact.description:
The delta to the FinancialAccount's balance. The balance_impact for the Transaction is equal to sum of its
TransactionEntries that have `effective_at`s in the past.

category.description: Open Enum. A descriptive category used to classify the Transaction.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

financial_account.description: Indicates the FinancialAccount affected by this Transaction.

type.description: Open Enum. Type of the flow that created the Transaction. The field matching this value will contain the ID of the flow.

adjustment.description: If applicable, the ID of the Adjustment that created this Transaction.

currency_conversion.description: In the future, this will be the ID of the currency conversion that created this Transaction. For now, this field is always null.

fee_transaction.description: If applicable, the ID of the FeeTransaction that created this Transaction.

inbound_transfer.description: If applicable, the ID of the InboundTransfer that created this Transaction.

outbound_payment.description: If applicable, the ID of the OutboundPayment that created this Transaction.

outbound_transfer.description: If applicable, the ID of the OutboundTransfer that created this Transaction.

received_credit.description: If applicable, the ID of the ReceivedCredit that created this Transaction.

received_debit.description: If applicable, the ID of the ReceivedDebit that created this Transaction.

flow.description: Details about the Flow object that created the Transaction.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

status.description:
Closed Enum. Current status of the Transaction.
A Transaction is `pending` if either `balance_impact.inbound_pending` or `balance_impact.outbound_pending` is non-zero.
A Transaction is `posted` if only `balance_impact.available` is non-zero.
A Transaction is `void` if there is no balance impact.
`posted` and `void` are terminal states, and no additional entries will be added to the Transaction.

posted_at.description: The time at which the Transaction became posted. Only present if status == posted.

void_at.description: The time at which the Transaction became void. Only present if status == void.

status_transitions.description: Timestamps for when the Transaction transitioned to a particular status.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.money_management.transaction.description: Use Transactions to view changes to your FinancialAccount balance over time. Every flow that moves money, such as OutboundPayments or ReceivedCredits, will have one or more Transactions that describes how the flow impacted your balance. Note that while the FinancialAccount balance will always be up to date, be aware that Transactions and TransactionEntries are created shortly after to reflect changes.

v1_id.description: Id of the v1 Transaction corresponding to this Transaction.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

currency_conversion.description: In the future, this will be the ID of the currency conversion that created this Transaction. For now, this field is always null.

inbound_transfer.description: If applicable, the ID of the InboundTransfer that created this Transaction.

outbound_payment.description: If applicable, the ID of the OutboundPayment that created this Transaction.

received_debit.description: If applicable, the ID of the ReceivedDebit that created this Transaction.

v2.money_management.transaction_entry.description: TransactionEntries represent individual money movements across different states within a Transaction.
